item.title: Blinken arrives in Israel to push cease-fire deal amid doubts of success
item.dc:creator: John Hudson, Susannah George, Niha Masih, Annabelle Timsit, Hajar Harb, Jennifer Hassan
item.description: Secretary of State Antony Blinken is in Israel for a trip focused on bridging the gaps between Israel and Hamas on a U.S.-sponsored cease-fire proposal.

item.title: Kremlin response to Kursk incursion shows how Putin freezes in a crisis
item.dc:creator: Robyn Dixon
item.description: When Russian President Vladimir Putin’s authority is tested, his response often lacks quick, decisive action that lives up to his bellicose rhetoric.

item.title: Venezuelans stage global protests, seek recognition of election victory
item.dc:creator: Ana Herrero, Samantha Schmidt, María Luisa Paúl
item.description: In Venezuela and cities around the world, protesters carried vote tally receipts collected by the opposition showing that their candidate won more votes.

item.title: Gaza faces public health crisis with first confirmed case of polio
item.dc:creator: Bryan Pietsch
item.description: The United Nations is now pushing for a pause in the fighting so it can coordinate two mass vaccination campaigns for more than 640,000 children.

item.title: X closes operations in Brazil, blames judge’s ‘censorship’ orders
item.dc:creator: Jaclyn Peiser
item.description: The social media platform and owner Elon Musk have been feuding with Brazilian Justice Alexandre de Moraes for months.

item.title: Why Indonesia moved its capital to a jungle hundreds of miles away
item.dc:creator: Bryan Pietsch
item.description: The new city, Nusantara, comes as Jakarta continues to sink at a record pace.

item.title: Israeli strikes in Gaza and Lebanon kill at least 25, officials say
item.dc:creator: Kareem Fahim, Mohamad El Chamaa, Suzan Haidamous, Frances Vinall, Victoria Bisset
item.description: Saturday’s bloodshed came after the United States and its allies expressed optimism over cease-fire negotiations to end the war in Gaza.

item.title: Jared Kushner wants to turn a wild stretch of Albania into a luxury resort
item.dc:creator: Chico Harlan, Michael Kranish, Isaac Stanley-Becker
item.description: Kushner’s use of foreign funds is again coming under scrutiny. Environmentalists fear his planned resort could destroy a delicate ecosystem.

item.title: What to know about Indian protests over a student doctor’s rape and killing
item.dc:creator: Adela Suliman
item.description: Indian doctors have called a 24-hour strike following the rape and killing of a female trainee doctor in Kolkata and protests have swept major cities this week.

item.title: What Kamala Harris did – and didn’t do – on immigration and the border
item.dc:creator: Toluse Olorunnipa, Maria Sacchetti
item.description: Vice President Kamala Harris worked with three Central American countries to improve living conditions and lower the odds that migrants would leave.

item.title: Inflation has come for one of Japan’s most beloved cheap eats: Ramen
item.dc:creator: Michelle Lee, Julia Mio Inuma
item.description: Japanese ramen joints are going out of business at a record pace as restaurants struggle with rising prices of ingredients, electricity and wages.

item.title: Ukraine’s offensive derails secret efforts for partial cease-fire with Russia, officials say
item.dc:creator: Isabelle Khurshudyan, Siobhán O'Grady, John Hudson, Catherine Belton
item.description: The warring countries were set to hold indirect talks in Qatar on an agreement to halt strikes on energy and power infrastructure, according to officials.

item.title: U.S. proposes new Gaza cease-fire plan, seeking agreement by next week
item.dc:creator: John Hudson, Frances Vinall, Victoria Bisset, Hazem Balousha, Missy Ryan
item.description: The United States, Qatar and Egypt said in a joint statement that a new cease-fire proposal was on the table, but they did not include any specifics on the deal.

item.title: In a Ukrainian prison, cells are full of young Russian conscripts
item.dc:creator: Siobhán O'Grady, Tetiana Burianova, Mary Ilyushina, Serhiy Morgunov
item.description: The capture of so many young men in the Ukrainian incursion poses a significant challenge for the Kremlin.

item.title: Illegal border crossings fell in July to lowest level in four years
item.dc:creator: Maria Sacchetti, Nick Miroff
item.description: Border agents tallied 56,408 illegal crossings in July, a 32 percent decline from June and the fifth straight month that the figure has fallen, data shows.

item.title: West Bank village mourns resident killed in settler attack
item.dc:creator: Heidi Levine, Miriam Berger
item.description: The attack late Thursday in Jit in the northern West Bank was the latest in a string of assaults by settlers on Palestinian communities.
